page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY-CHURCHES
page.content: St.Andrew's Church in the centre of Woodhall Spa was demolished in 1957 after being substantially damaged in German air raids during World War Two. In the graveyard of the old church there remains a sundial and a stone monument which marks the position of the old church altar.The local primary school is still named after this church. The village now has a new church,St. Peter's,a brick building constructed at the end of the nineteenth century. Other denominations are catered for within the village which boasts a Methodist and Roman Catholic church.
